trustfund:
TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF023105-PHRD-POPULATION PROJECT II,TF029221-PHRD -NORTHERN HEALTH & EDUC.(BANK-EXECUTED)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Population Welfare Program
            Project's overall outcome is rated as satisfactory. The
            sustained fiscal crisis in Pakistan after the first one to
            two years of the project implementation constrained the
            government's capacity to finance its share of the
            overall program as agreed at the appraisal. A number of
            important lessons have been learned through this project. 1)
            Moving to a reproductive health approach can be helpful with
            integration of services. 2) It is difficult to have
            administrative decentralization in the presence of a
            centralized funding mechanism. 3) The deployment of women as
            trainers and supervisors greatly facilitates the recruitment
            of female outreach workers. 4) Relying on the procurement of
            technical assistance for institutional capacity development
            is a risky strategy. 5) The experience with procurement
            points to the critical importance of having an overall
            detailed procurement plan before implementation starts. 6)
            It is necessary to have a detailed appraisal of the
            financial management system to be carried out at inception,
            and for minimum improvements to be required and implemented
            prior to approval of the project.
